meanings.definition: To haul or hoist with a tackle.
meanings.sent1: The sailors triced the heavy cargo onto the ship.
meanings.sent2: They triced up the sails to catch the wind and move forward.
meanings.sent3: The crew triced a barrel of rum up the mast for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: She triced her hopes high, ready to face any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The workers triced the flag to the top of the pole, signaling the start of the event.

meanings.definition: To pull or haul with a rope or tackle.
meanings.sent1: We triced the fishing net out of the water, hoping for a good catch.
meanings.sent2: He triced the heavy box onto the truck bed with great effort.
meanings.sent3: The children triced the wagon full of toys around the yard, laughing all the way.
meanings.sent4: She triced her emotions tightly, not letting anyone see her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The team triced the giant pumpkin onto the scale, eager to see if it broke the record.
